definition: to be both mentally and physically exhausted (idiom)
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
surname Li
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
care-worn/distressed/tired/overworked/sick/weary

sentences.english: Dealing with the latter can be anguishing and taxing.
sentences.chinese: 与后者打交道会让人心力交瘁，痛苦不堪。

sentences.english: If you are constantly overwhelmed, you will burn out.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不断受到打击，你将会心力交瘁。

sentences.english: Only then transfers however sees toward being mentally and physically exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 才转然看到过往的心力交瘁。

sentences.english: We suddenly the whole person mentally and physically exhausted, a lot of aging.
sentences.chinese: 天禄心力交瘁，一下子整个人衰老了很多。

sentences.english: That was eight years ago. It was an unnerving experience.
sentences.chinese: 这是八年前的一段让我心力交瘁的经历。

sentences.english: This trouble has really broken him up.
sentences.chinese: 这件麻烦事确实使他心力交瘁。

sentences.english: Till our own weakness shows us what we are.
sentences.chinese: 直到心力交瘁，方知自己是谁。

definition: physically and emotionally exhausted
worn out in body and soul (idiom)
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
lit. badly burned about the head (from trying to put out a fire) (idiom)/fig. hard-pressed/under pressure (from a heavy workload, creditors etc)
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
lit. heart distracted, thoughts in turmoil (idiom); distraught with anxiety
taxing (mentally or emotionally)
nervous breakdown
tired/exhausted
to be so in pain as to not want to live/to be so grieved as to wish one were dead
(idiom) terribly busy/up to one's ears in work
no thought for tea or rice (idiom); melancholic and suffering/to have no appetite
